subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests
msgSnippet: ... Okay, step by step instructions: 1) Run the suite first, to generate the test instances. 2) Using the JUnit hierarchy or failures tab, locate the test you
messageBody:
On 10/19/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
> Robert, in Eclipse versions from 2.x to 3.2 test case that I've
> posted here give you an error "unable to find test method" or
> something like that. About 50% of its testcases fail all the time, so
> you have quite good choice there.

Okay, step by step instructions:

1) Run the suite first, to generate the test instances.
2) Using the JUnit hierarchy or failures tab, locate the test you want
to re-run.
3) Right-click on it. Select "Run" or "Debug" from the context menu to
re-run it.

Note that if you double-click on it, you get the following error:
"Method '<whatever>' not found. Opening the test class". This is
because double-click attempts to open the test, not run it.

> I'd be very surprised if your Eclipse give you different result and
> very much would like to learn how did you do that. :-)

I did nothing special. Oh, the above was for Eclipse 3.1, though it
definitely worked in 3.0 as well (I only upgraded last week). Dunno
about 2.

NB: If you use the Continuous Testing plugin, you have to tell it to
leave JUnit running. And it gives you a nice little dialog warning
message to let you know if you try.

(Sorry for the delay in responding... wanted to get back into work to
verify the exact steps)

--
